item.title: The Weakest Model in the Selector
item.description: A chain is only as strong un­der ten­sion as its weak­est link, and an AI chat sys­tem is, un­der nor­mal de­sign choices, as se­cure as the weak­est model in the se­lec­tor. While this is rel­a­tively easy to miti­gate, An­thropic is the only chat ser­vice I know of that ac­tu­ally pre­vents ......

item.title: In Favor of Inkhaven-But-Less
item.description: One of the main com­plaints I heard about the Inkaven Res­i­dency is that it put too much pres­sure on peo­ple to write too quickly. The fel­low­ship was based on the premise that peo­ple who pub­lish ev­ery day have his­tor­i­cally......

item.title: Reasons to care about Canary Strings

item.title: Slack Observability
item.description:
Once upon a time, I took a park­our class. One day, there was a les­son on how to jump safely, and more im­por­tanty, how to land safely. The in­struc­tor climbed up on top of a tall box and jumped down, bend­ing his knees into a deep squat, ab­sorb­ing the im­pact like a spring.

item.title: Gemini 3 is Evaluation-Paranoid and Contaminated
item.description: TL;DR: Gem­ini 3 fre­quently thinks it is in an eval­u­a­tion when it is not, as­sum­ing that all of its re­al­ity is fabri­cated. It can also re­li­ably out­put the BIG-bench ca­nary string, in­di­cat­ing that Google likely t......
